LanguageData.RealRuins_ModOptions_AllowUploads: Allow uploading your bases to ruins database
LanguageData.RealRuins_ModOptions_AllowDownloadsToolt: If you switch this off, it won't remove anything you have already downloaded.
LanguageData.RealRuins_ModOptions_AllowUploadsTooltip: It's recommended to keep this on to help populate database with various interesting base designs. This should not consume more than several megabytes per game session.
LanguageData.RealRuins_ModOptions_CacheSizeTooltip: Even if you reach this limit, the mod will continue downloading new blueprints, removing the older ones.
LanguageData.RealRuins_ModOptions_OfflineModeTooltip: This mode will delete all cached data that was downloaded from the server and prevent any further uploads and downloads. However, your own bases will still be stored locally and used for creating ruins in your game.
LanguageData.RealRuins_MapOptions_DensityTT: Average number of ruins spawned on 100x100 area
LanguageData.RealRuins_MapOptions_SizeTT: Ruins area is selected randomly in range between 50% to 150% of the entered value
LanguageData.RealRuins_MapOptions_DeteriorationTT: This value determines additional chance for a tile to be destroyed and does not influence remaining hit points amount. Zero is default setting, max will result in no ruins at all.
LanguageData.RealRuins_MapOptions_CostLimitTT: All items with total cost higher than selected value will be destroyed
LanguageData.RealRuins_MapOptions_DisableHaulablesTT: All haulable items won't spawn, but furniture may still appear
LanguageData.RealRuins_MapOptions_WallsAndDoorsOnlyTT: This setting is pretty aggressive and will remove everything that is not based on a vanilla wall or a door.
LanguageData.RealRuins_MapOptions_ClaimableTT: Unclaimable structures can't be repaired or deconstructed
LanguageData.RealRuins_MapOptions_EnableProximityTT: Settlement proximity influences generation parameters: ruins are more dense near cities, but also more empty.
LanguageData.RealRuins_MapOptions_StartWithoutRuinsTT: No ruins will be generated on starting map. Later ruins will be generated normally accoring to settings.
LanguageData.RealRuins.PlanetaryRuinsSettings.Caption: Planetary ruins and locations
LanguageData.RealRuins.CacheSettings.Caption: Cache settings
LanguageData.RealRuins.SpawnSettings.Caption: Spawn settings
LanguageData.RealRuins.PlanetarySettings.Enable: Enable spawning ruin at game start
LanguageData.RealRuins.PlanetarySettings.DownloadLimi: Maximum number of blueprints to download
LanguageData.RealRuins.PlanetarySettings.TransferLimi: Maximum number of locations to spawn
LanguageData.LetterCaravanEnteredRuins: {0} has arrived at the abandoned base ruins and is ready to begin scavenging.
LanguageData.RealRuins.CaravanFoundRuins: During their travel {0} spotted a bunch of destroyed buildings nearby, which seem to be in a better condition than usual. Probably there still are some valuables left. On the other hand, there might be wild animals lair, mechanoids nest or raiders outpost: there should be a reason why those buildings seem untouched.
LanguageData.RealRuins_MapOptions_CaravanReforming: Enable instant caravan reforming between raids
LanguageData.RealRuins_MapOptions_CaravanReformingTT: Normally during ruins scavenging events you should not be able to reform caravan instantly right after the initial hostile party is defeated. By design you had to manually search for loot, pick up and leave using map edge even if there are no hostile units right now. However, if you prefer the old way with overpowered instant reform feature, you can enable this feature
LanguageData.DeterioratedArtDescription: This item is too worn and damaged. You can tell for sure it was a beautiful art object once, but now you can hardly guess what it was about.
LanguageData.RealRuins.NoMoreEnemies: Looks like no one's gonna show up anymore. You can safely pack up and leave. (Instant caravan reform allowed)
LanguageData.RealRuins.DescPOI0: A small group of buildings, presumably of military kind. Probably an armoury or a small transit military base. It can have several stationary weapons and a dozen or two soldiers.
LanguageData.RealRuins.DescPOI1: A very small military outpost, couple of rooms, couple of turrets, couple of soldiers.
LanguageData.RealRuins.DescPOI2: A temporary camp set up to mine resources, hunt or as a trans-shipment point.
LanguageData.RealRuins.DescPOI3: A large thriving city. Even though it usually does not have massive walls or a lot of stationary weapons, it can request powerful reinforcements in case of an assault.
LanguageData.RealRuins.DescPOI4: Those buildings contain a lot of workbenches and produced goods. Most likely the factory is well guarded.
LanguageData.RealRuins.DescPOI5: Research and development center is focused on production, but goods are more sophisticated and pricey than in a regular factory. Most likely it's well guarded and guards will call reinforcements as soon as you decide to assault.
LanguageData.RealRuins.DescPOI6: A group of buildings focused primarily on power production.
LanguageData.RealRuins.DescPOI7: A large military base with lots of stationary weapons, several dozens of personnel and reinforcements ready to arrive.
LanguageData.RealRuins.DescPOI8: From distance it looks like a large hangar filled with goods. And a lot of guards.
LanguageData.RealRuins.DescPOI9: Small building which looks like a communication center. Probably just a temporary military camp with just a few guards.
LanguageData.RealRuins.DescPOI10: Remainings of some buildings, bits of furniture, broken workbenches, pipes and metal bars. You can't tell what it was long ago, everything left is just empty ruins.
LanguageData.RealRuins.DescPOI11: Heavily guarded stronghold. Extremely well defended with tons of stationary weapons, troops and reinforcements.
LanguageData.RealRuins.POINowRuined: Once this place was a {0}, full of life, but now it's abandoned, no one knows why. So better beware of all kinds of danger.
LanguageData.RealRuins.POIUselessRuins: You wonder what it could be long ago. Now it's mostly rock and rubble.
LanguageData.LetterCaravanEnteredUnownedPOI: {0} has arrived at destination. Proceed with caution.
LanguageData.LetterTransportPodsArrivedInUnownedPOI: Transport pods have arrived at destination.
LanguageData.LetterTransportPodsAttackedPOI: Transport pods have arrived at destination. Attack has begun.
LanguageData.LetterLabelTransportPodsArrivedAtRuins: Transport pods have arrived at ruins
LanguageData.LetterTransportPodsArrivedAtRuins: Transport pods have arrived at ruins
LanguageData.RealRuins.LoadBlueprintsDescription: This feature will load maps of other players who had their colonies on the same planet. Their colonies will be spawned as other factions' settlements and outposts, or as abandoned ruins. Unlike random ruins, those will be placed at their original locations.
LanguageData.RealRuins.OptionsDescription: In this mode you can control every step. At first you load just count of blueprints for the planet and can adjust how many of them do you want to download as blueprints. Then, after loading, you can adjust how many do you want to be transferred and how filtration should be done. You can stop during each step, remove everything and start over.
LanguageData.RealRuins.PlanetaryRuinsNote: NOTE: This is a separate feature which works independently of random ruins on all maps or special ruins events.
LanguageData.RealRuins.MapSizeChangeWarning: WARNING: If you're going to change map size, press Close now and download blueprints after changing map size.
LanguageData.RealRuins.LowCountWarning: You have too few blueprints. If it bothers you, try to select another seed or map settings. You can check the most populated worlds by visiting https://woolstrand.art/view/maps/topseeds
LanguageData.RealRuins.NoBlueprintsWarning.Caption: Sorry
LanguageData.RealRuins.NoBlueprintsWarning.Text: This world does not contain any maps. It means, nobody have yet played with the same seed, coverage and map size. If you want to have some locations on the world map, try selecting more common seed. You can check the most populated worlds by visiting https://woolstrand.art/view/maps/topseeds
LanguageData.RealRuins.LoadBlueprintsFirst: You need to load blueprints first.
LanguageData.RealRuins.LoadedAmount: Server has {0} blueprints for this planet.
LanguageData.RealRuins.TooManyBlueprints.Load.Title: Seems there is a whole lot of blueprints!
LanguageData.RealRuins.TooManyBlueprints.Load.Text: Server says, this world has {0} blueprints. This can take a while to download and process, and the world map can become cluttered. If it's your first time using this game mode, it's recommended to limit blueprint count.
LanguageData.RealRuins.TooManyBlueprints.Transfer.Tit: A lot of blueprints to process!
LanguageData.RealRuins.TooManyBlueprints.Transfer.Tex: You have {0} blueprints loaded. It may take a lot of time to process and transfer each one of them and it may overpopulate
LanguageData.RealRuins.TooManyBlueprints.ShowOptions: Show advanced settings and let me decide
LanguageData.RealRuins.BiomeFilteringTT: Exclude maps with missing or mismatching biome
LanguageData.RealRuins.CostFilteringTT: Exclude maps with too low cost (lower than average "empty" map)
LanguageData.RealRuins.AreaFilteringTT: Exclude maps with too small area and too low items count
LanguageData.RealRuins.DiscardAbandonedTT: Discard all maps that do not qualufy as any specific kind of POIs (this usually drops about a half of all maps)
LanguageData.RealRuins.NeedsGameInProgress: You have to be in an ongoing game to use this menu
LanguageData.RealRuins.CaravanReformTooltip: Way of caravan reforming in Real Ruins events. "Automatic" is the same way as caravan is formed on your home map. "Instant" allows instant reform via button on the world map. "Manual" is for manual items pickup and leaving via map edge.
LanguageData.RealRuins.ForceMultiplierTT: Tune this to make ruins event more or less difficult
LanguageData.RealRuins.AbsoluteWealthCapTT: Determines absolute wealth cap for ruins events. Wooden walls and doors are not counted against total wealth.
LanguageData.RealRuins.LeaveVanillaRuinsTT: If checked, both real ruins and vanilla ruins will be spawned
LanguageData.RealRuins.FactionOwnedStartTileDesc: You're about to enter a tile with a settlement on it, and this settlement belongs to another faction. You can either make it abandoned and settle in ruins, you can make it yours, or you can attack it with your starting party.
